title:
A bosonic matrix product state description of Read-Rezayi states and its
  application to quasi-hole spins
abstract:
We study the $k=3$ Read-Rezayi quantum Hall state by means of a purely
bosonic matrix product state formulation, which is described in detail. We
calculate the density profiles in the presence of bulk quasi-holes of six
different types: one for each $\mathbb{Z}_3$ parafermion sector. From the
density profiles, we calculate the (local) spins of these quasi-holes. By
employing a spin-statistics relation, we obtain the exchange statistics
parameters. Our results, which are entirely based on local properties of the
quasi-holes, corroborate previous results obtained by explicitly braiding
quasi-holes, showing that the exchange statistics can be read off from the
monodromy properties of the wave functions, i.e., that the associated Berry
phase vanishes. We also discuss the entanglement spectrum, to show that our
bosonic matrix product state formulation correctly captures the $\mathbb{Z}_3$
parafermionic structure of the $k=3$ Read-Rezayi states.
